Reviews.Title: “A great value in pricey Venice”
Reviews.Author: Oregon-travellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ai do Mori is a great value IF one does not mind climbing stairs and buying breakfast at a nearby coffee shop. The location is perfect - just around the corner from Piazzo San Marco -- the corner right next to the basilica. Our room for 3 persons (1 double, 1 single bed) was on the top floor (3rd by European count, 4th by American count) so we got plenty of exercise at least twice a day. But in exchange we were right in the middle of the most notable part of Venice but without so much noise that we couldn't sleep at night. I had anticipated our room for three would be so crowded we would have to climb over beds to get to the bathroom, but that wasn't the case. It was small but there was plenty of room for us (two grandparents and 16 year old granddaughter).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ai do Mori, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Oregon-travellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ai do Mori is a great value IF one does not mind climbing stairs and buying breakfast at a nearby coffee shop. The location is perfect - just around the corner from Piazzo San Marco -- the corner right next to the basilica. Our room for 3 persons (1 double, 1 single bed) was on the top floor (3rd by European count, 4th by American count) so we got plenty of exercise at least twice a day. But in exchange we were right in the middle of the most notable part of Venice but without so much noise that we couldn't sleep at night. I had anticipated our room for three would be so crowded we would have to climb over beds to get to the bathroom, but that wasn't the case. It was small but there was plenty of room for us (two grandparents and 16 year old granddaughter).

Reviews.Title: “only good thing is LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lino S
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms, one of which was in the annex. The annex room was ok and on first floor. The other 2 rooms were on the 3rd floor. One was so small, I got stuck between the bed and the wall while trying to go out the door (ok so the bed cover was on the ground at the foot of the bed). This hotel is only suitable for anyone willing to lug a suitcase up 3 very steep and narrow flights of stairs or backpackers, all of which I have done. The rooms were also over an alleyway and there were very loud people outside till 5:00 AM. I would not recommend this for seniors.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Margarinespread
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our accommodation at Hotel ai do Mori. The location is superb really only 1 min if even walk to st marks Square. Our room was number 7 and while small it was very clean and cosy. The shared bathroom was also always very clean. I could not recommend this hotel more highly! Amazing value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “5 nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travel007_8
Reviews.Content: and this hotel was the perfect place to stay. So close to St. Marks, great view of the bell tower and the price could not be beat. We were given a great suggestion for dinner and directions to a local sports bar to watch the Milan game. The room was clean and spacious enough. And they even helped me with my Italian :-).

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel for a budget price!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all we needed for a simple venice stay! It really is a stone's throw from St. Marks square meaning you can walk everywhere in Venice which is ideal. We stayed in a top floor room meaning we could see the Bell tower and here the bells every morning. The room was small but clean and had all the basics. We knew we wouldn't spend much time in the hotel as we'd be out and about exploring so location was a priority and this hotel is perfect! It means you can pop back for a quick siesta without having to get a vaporetto everytime! Staff were friendly and helpful. Basic hotel, but great price for the amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & a reasonable price for Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelbuginperth
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this hotel average because the rooms are rather tired looking and the bathroom dated, the access includes steep narrow stairs and no elevator so not suitable for those with mobility concerns. But overall the stay was pleasant enough, it was a quiet hotel & it was an inexpensive option for Venice standards for myself and 3 others accommodating 2 rooms. Be aware of increased tourist taxes. The best part about this hotel is that it is right next San Marco's Square. I recommend this for budget conscious couples/families and namely for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Six night stay at the Hotel Ai do Mori, Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: Peter_S_in_Aus
Reviews.Content: This place worked well for us - we stayed there between Christmas and New Year several years ago. Well located, and good staff. Ignore the date of stay - it was December 2007 I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hbbooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HOTEL AI DO MORI for three nights at the beginning of March and we would highly recommend it. The location was ideal for visiting the most popular sights in Venice. The room we stayed in (#6) was charming, quiet, clean, and had a view of the top of the bell tower in Piazza S. Marco. Though small, the room suited our needs perfectly and we were very comfortable there. The staff was friendly, accommodating, and helpful. We expected to pay much more for all this, especially in Venice, and we were surprised by the extraordinarily reasonable cost of our stay. We would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: horse54101
Reviews.Content: Great location, reasonably priced, spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff, would definately recommend this hotel. All that was missing was tea-making facilities but it's right on the doorstep of some great cafes and restaurants. Understood our 'pigeon Italian' and spoke very good English! I think they appreciated our efforts to speak the language.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ai Do Mori, Venice”
Reviews.Author: pranyama
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Annexe at Carnvial in February. Great Location, nice warm bedroom. we'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KuroroMe
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in Venice, it took us a while to find this hotel though we know it is near St Marks Square. When you arrive in Venezia Santa Lucia station, we took a one-way river taxi to Rialto for Euro 6.50 per pax. From Rialto, we got lost for a while (though we have a map with us) and eventually found the hotel after about 20 mins. Like many other B&Bs/hotels, be prepared to lug your luggage up a few flights of stairs. The staff were helpful to provide you with information about Venice and places to eat. The room, though small, was very clean. Venice is an expensive city, but given this hotel's location, I think the price is definitely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Lovely Room.”
Reviews.Author: Timo K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Annex Room at Hotel ai do Mori which was excellently located in Venice just 20M from St Marks Square and had our own shower room. The staff were very helpful and the room was lovely with wooden beams, a comfortable bed, lovely shower, and other standard items. Not sure how people can complain at the price as Â£50 for the night for two people for such a location is an absolute bargain! If we were ever to go to Venice again we would definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Abe_Froman05
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed a bit pricey when we booked it, until we realized everything in Venice is expensive. Still, for the price I would've expected slightly nicer accommodations. Our room was incredibly small and outdated. Just enough space to walk around the bed, and hardly any room to set down your luggage. Not the end of the world since we really only used the room for sleeping and showering. Just be prepared to be really cramped during your stay. That said, keep in mind that you are paying to stay in the heart of Venice. You will literally be a stones throw from St. Mark's square. This was a really nice convenience. And to their credit, the staff speaks English and was helpful when we needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: nanalq
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The location was awesome awesome awesome :D . The staff was great we got a free proseco bottle for the new years. The room was super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CMac1029
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased. Although the room was small, it was clean and comfortable. The best thing about this hotel is the location--literally a stone's throw from St. Mark's Square. We thought the hotel was a great value for the location. There was no elevator which might be an issue for folks with mobility issues. We had no problem with climbing the stairs and looked it as an opportunity to burn off the calories from all the gelato we ate! If you're looking for a hotel that is clean, reasonably priced and in a stellar location then look no further than Hotel ai do Mori.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: This is a great value - my family stayed in rooms 4 and 5, a private suite with two rooms and a private bathroom connected by a hallway. The rooms are small and modest. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is right by St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Venice”
Reviews.Author: jamesbond007Belgium
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Venice. Very friendly people. Price - quality best there is. Near St Marc's place (10 meter). They even have a room where you can see the two More's on a private terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: AndrewPalmieri
Reviews.Content: It was amazing to find such a lovely little hotel in the centre of Venice, just of St Marco square. The rooms are quite cosy and modern and the staff are friendly. The prices are very reasonable too, considering the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: lindybToronto
Reviews.Content: Fantastic price for this location. It's a small hotel with very helpful staff (Tatiana) just a block away from St. Mark's Square. We stayed in the Annex (the Lion Room) which was very clean with a private bathroom. The room was above the street but the windows did well to block out any noise. It's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, musty bed sheets, great value”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Traveller007
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable. You are literally a golf swing from San Marco Square. Good hot water pressure, warm rooms, bed was ok. Only complaint was the bed sheets smelled musty. My allergies went nuts as a result. Other linens were clean.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a single room as I was travelling on my own, but once it was decided my mother was coming with me we changed it to a twin room. I had some trepidation taking my mother to a budget hotel in a famous European city, but the worry was all in vein. The room was absolutely charming, small but perfectly formed with a view you couldnâ€™t put a price on. We stayed in room 6 at the top of the hotel and had an amazing view of the campanile and bell tower â€“ so much so we could see the arm striking as clear as day. The room was immaculate, clean and fresh and the beds were very comfortable. The staff are friendly but donâ€™t expect them to wait on you hand and foot â€“ so pack light as there are LOTS of stairs to go up. This hotel is what it is, a small budget hotel in a great location with clean, comfortable rooms. If you are the sort of traveller who likes to spend hours relaxing in the hotel taking advantage of a large variety of facilities then this hotel isnâ€™t for you â€“ but then why would you come to Venice to stay in the hotel room? We loved it and felt like we were locals, popping out to the coffee bar opposite for our morning espresso. For those who love to visit cities, spending all day sightseeing and just require a convenient, clean and comfortable room to retire to for a good nightâ€™s sleep before another packed day â€“ I canâ€™t recommend it enough. We would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and value”
Reviews.Author: Korinne
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, ideally located and excellent value for money. It is basic but exceptionally clean i would stay here again in a heartbeat. There is no restaurant but the restaurants recommendations are excellent and can be trusted. Stayed in room 10 which did not have a wiew to speak of, i think a Bar is outside the window on the street so one night it got loud but with the window closed i slept perfectly well. Room 11 has a view but was not available.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Darlene F
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Venice, I was overwhelmed with the amount of people that filled the Saint Marks Square area. As I made my way through the crowds toward Hotel ai do Mori, I prayed for a comfortable, quiet space where I could collect my thoughts and rest.....Hotel ai do Mori fulfilled my prayer. I entered into the quiet, peaceful space and was very pleased with the simple and more than adequate accommodations they offered. The manager was very helpful and I enjoyed my 3 night stay. Would I return?....Yes....I send my thanks for all of their help and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireAlex
Reviews.Content: The ai da mori is within a stone's throw of busy St Marks Square. The bells are no real problem but take ear plugs just in case they bother you. The owners are very friendly and give good tips on local restaurants etc. The rooms are small but very clean. A great choice of hotel if you dont plan on spending too much time in your room in this fantastic city and you can cope with the steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice staff, around the corner from San Marco piazza”
Reviews.Author: nctampa
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a great bargain, and very easy to find. We packed wisely & had no heavy luggage to worry about, so the stairs were not a problem for us. Unfortunately, we had the least attractive room (#4-think walk-in closet sized), but we were forewarned by the owners that it was small & 1 flight up to the shared bathroom (shared with room #7, which was much more pleasant - I got a peek when the housekeeper was cleaning). In #4, the foot of the bed was literally 1 foot from the wall, & the side of the bed was 3 small steps into the room, which was about 10X7 in size. Room was very clean & the a/c was cold, so it worked fine for us, but if you have too much luggage, this may not work for you. For 84E & the fantastic location, we could overlook the size. The staff were very friendly & allowed us to use their computer when we needed to rebook a room for later in our trip. Our advice for owners would be new pillows please. Ours were flat & hard, & I woke up with a crick in my neck. I would definitely recommend the property, but maybe not room #4, unless you need to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: R3ady-to-G0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect location - just two blocks from St. Mark's Basilica. The room was small (as anticipated), yet absolutely perfect for our needs. The hotel's office staff were delightful and were very helpful and welcoming. There were only two down-side's I can say - 1) restorations were being done while we were there, so our would-be view was blocked 2) the beds were very firm, which some people might like, but I didn't. Overall, I would recommend this hotel because of it's location and resonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hear the bells of San Marco: Sweet rooftop room”
Reviews.Author: cyclinjohn
Reviews.Content: The Painter's Room, tucked under ancient rafters, includes a private rooftop patio with a view. What a lovely place to enjoy your morning coffee! You pay for the view and location near San Marco Piazza, and you work for it, i.e. no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, in a historic townhouse right off St. Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: MSelva81
Reviews.Content: The Hotel ai do Mori is in a 500-year-old townhouse right off of St. Mark's Square. If you're lucky enough to get the room we had (#7 or #11 -- I can't remember which), you can see the Campanile and the Moors. An amazing location. Now, you do have to be willing to climb -- there are no lifts and the hotel starts on the third floor of the building. But think of it as penance for all the great seafood and pasta you'll eat while you're there. The room itself was small, but comfortable. And it was right next to the bathroom, which was nice, even though the room itself has a sink and a mirror. In terms of value, you're really paying for location, so it's not bad when you factor that in. Know, though, that if you want to pay by credit card, there is an additional daily fee of 10 euros. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jerry v
Reviews.Content: After seeing the other reviews we thoroughly looked forward staying here; we even cancelled another hotel reservation for this place. Unfortunately, a few weeks after booking they emailed us that all the windows had to be closed and that there would be workers around a lot due to unexpected renovations on the facade of the building. They kindly offered us a similar room in a befriended hotel, so everything worked out perfectly fine. An incredible example of unconditional hospitality and service!

Reviews.Title: “Next time I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Alessia_XS
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in the very vicinity to San Marco square. Easy to find. Bell ringing of the tower clock was not annoying at all, both this and the street noise did not get into our room on the third floor. We knew there was no lift but having just one 8 kilo bag managed quite all right, we were also aware of the absence of catering facilities in the hotel. There are plenty of places to eat around. Staf was amiable and hospitable. If you do not intend to spend a bunch of money for luxurious accommodation with magnificent view you will appreciate the cosiness of Ai do mori.

Reviews.Title: “the real finding at San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Marinesku_Semen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Painter room for 3 nights in the end of July. It's tiny but it's nicely decorated, cosy, spotless and the best feature of this room is lovely spacious terrace. Location can't be better if you want to be close to San Marco. Very firendly and helpful staff. As it's been already mentioned here there's no elevator, so you have to be able to take steps but it wasn't problem for us at all. We would definitely stay here again next time we're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money, particularly for Venice”
Reviews.Author: luvhb
Reviews.Content: As I was searching through the exorbitantly expensive Venice hotels, Hotel Al Di Mori seemed too good to be true at almost half the cost of other "bare bones" places. I read the reviews, reserved it and hoped for the best. We arrived in Marco Polo airport on a Friday, took the airport express bus to Piazzale Roma, then the Vaporetto to San Marco. Hotel Al Di Mori was located just a few meters off Saint Mark's square in the surrounding shopping / dining avenues. You walk up a half flight of stairs to reach the small reception room, then up a few more flights of stairs to get to your room, depending on which floor you are placed. Like many low cost Europe hotels, the hotel does not have a lift and the staircases are narrow and steep. If you packed light, this shouldn't be a problem, but if you brought a large rolling bag, I imagine it would be difficult to get it up to your room. We were on the third floor, which required quite a hike to get up to the room, but it also meant we didn't hear noise from the streets below. Our room was clean and very basic, the bed was comfortable and the showers were also clean and functional. The rooms did have air conditioning, which is essential for humid Venice nights in July. We would definitely take advantage of this bargain in Venice again, provided we packed light and there were no individuals with mobility problems in our group. If you do have someone in your group with any mobility problem, you can call to see if they have a ground-floor room available (you'll still need to go up a half-flight of stairs to get into the building) or search elsewhere. I highly suggest you pack light for a Venice trip or leave most of your luggage at the baggage drop in Piazzale Roma. In a city without cars, you'll find transportation is pricey, walking is generally necessary and the Vaporettos are very crowded. We did and made a great trip out of it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dana793
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were directed to the annex, and I was at first wary of the "bait and switch" I have heard at other hotels. There was no problem here. The room we had was one of them pictured on the website, so I felt we were getting exactly what we expected. The annex is literally around the corner. The location is PERFECT, just a 30 second walk from St. Mark's square. To arrive we took the Aguilera from the airport (~1 hour, but we had a terrible driver so it felt like forever). It was probably about a 8 minute walk over two bridges (one had a ramp) and thru the square to get to the hotel. I highly recommend one person staying downstairs to see if you room is in the annex or not before dragging all your luggage upstairs:) The room wasn't huge, but fine for a couple. There was even nice little table and two chairs. The room furnishings are by no means modern, but simple, country, and comfortable. No breakfast *but coffee and tea in the room), but I couldn't find anything else this close to St. Mark' square for anything near the price, so I think it more than evened out. Walking out of the hotel in the morning we literally had to wait for a break in the flow of traffic to get in. We, however, didn't hear ANYTHING in the room. We accidentally slept until 11am on the first day! (note, no alarm clock in the room, but I'm sure we could have gotten a wake up call). Also, couldn't an English speaking channel on TV, not a big deal to us becuase we just like background noise, but may make a difference to others. For anyone looking for a reasonable hotel room in Venice with reasonable expectations, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: historylover3388
Reviews.Content: Families can't beat this hotel's location for affordable, convenient and quaint accomodations in Venice. The staff (esp. Antoinette!) are wonderfully friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but very adequate--afterall, who spends much time in their room while in Venice?? As other reviewers have noted, there is no elevator, so be prepared to climb some stairs to get to your room. They are very clean and air conditioned once you get to them. The restaurant downstairs just to the left of the hotel entry is very good, and the coffee place just across from it on the right side is fine too. We understand that the hotel is currently doing some renovations and expanding for winter, 2011/12. One of these days I'm hoping to see this city in Oct./ Nov. and this would be my choice where to stay again. We were Americans on a family & friend tour, including three that are ages 22-24 years old. Those of us pushing age 60 were plenty tired by 11 PM after walking around all day. The younger ones definitely enjoyed being so close to St. Mark's Sq at night. They could stay out there for hours after the daytime crowds had thinned--listening to the "dueling orchestras" and sipping some nice Italian wine under the beautiful moon & stars. Really Marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hard to get to with heavy luggage”
Reviews.Author: drewrich1997
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from St. Mark's square--really can't beat it for exploring. However, be warned that there's no elevator, so heavy luggage is a workout getting up the stairs, not to mention after the vaporetto and the crossing the square. But they did give us free water at the top, which was a nice customer service touch as well as being super friendly pointing out restaurant ideas and where we could get laundry done. Room was a tad small, but shower/bed/AC was all in good working order. And the price was excellent! We would stay again, but next time on a shorter trip with lighter luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Greg154954
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for six nights in June, 2011. The location is fantastic and our room was absolutely charming with a view of the top of St. Mark's Square. The staff were very friendly and shared some Venetian secrets and booked us into great restaurants. Two downsides. They don't serve breakfast. And the stairs are steep and narrow with there's no elevator. However, we would gladly stay here again. The price was fair (for Venice) and we felt like we were made to feel like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kate255678
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the third floor and was very small but because we spent very little time in our room apart from sleeping this was not a problem. We enjoyed being so close to St Mark's Square. As we arrived and left by boat it was ideal, and also for sight-seeing. The hotel staff were always helpful when we asked about transport to various places and always had took time to check that everything was ok. Despite on-going repairs being under-taken we were never bothered by noise once the windows and shutters were closed.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: ERB43323
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. VERY close to all the action, yet very quiet for sleeping. The rooms were clean and the AC worked great! The best part was the owner. She made us feel welcome and safe. We really did not have high expectations when we booked, but they went above and beyond. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: wes16586
Reviews.Content: I visited with my boyfriend in June 2011. We expected to arrive at faulty towers after reading the reviews on here and comparing the price of our stay to other hotels in the area. When we arrived the receptionist was very helpful and polite. The room, although on the small side, was clean and more modern than we expected. The room was cleaned daily and sheets and towels were changed each day. Although the hotel was most probably fully booked, it was very quiet and easy to get a good nights sleep. The shared bathroom was not a problem as it was always clean and available for use. When asking the receptionist for information on transport or night life in the area they were always more than happy to oblige. On one occasion we asked for a restaurant recommendation and we were told of this little gem which had the BEST lasagne in Italy and a free glass of wine. The location of the hotel is unbelievable and we had a view of the bell tower in San Marco square from our room. Noise was never a problem considering the location of one of the more busy tourist areas during the day. After 1am the surrounding streets are empty and its the perfect opportunity to stroll from your hotel room and 30 seconds into San Marco square and see it empty of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Visit - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flipflopgirl04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex accommodation around the corner, checking in at the main hotel. There are steep stairs in the main hotel, but this is Venice and this is to be expected. The hotel is currently covered in scaffolding outside whilst essential work is being completed as requested by the city authorities - these will shortly be completed. The staff here are always friendly and welcoming. We preferred staying in the annex as probably quieter, but in the main hotel if you open your window it's instant Venice, with the sound of the bells, the clinking of wine glasses and knives & forks from the pavement restaurants. Good value, very clean, great location and quaint typical Venetian rooms - thank you Hotel ai do Mori - we will return to visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: cat60745
Reviews.Content: great location; you walk outside and you are literally right on a busy street with shops and restaurants, and less than 5 minutes from st marks square. surprisingly, its not loud at night, except for the chiming bells. our first night was spent in a location 2 minutes from the main hotel in a satelite location. the room was small but clean pleasant. the next night we were upgraded for free to room with a private balcony in the main hotel. this room was also very small, but nice and clean, and the balcony was amazing! it was the last night of our vacation, so we popped champagne and celebrated! 2 difficulties with this hotel; NO ELEVATOR, so be prepared to lug your heavy luggage up many stairs. also, no free breakfast (but many coffee shops in the area). this wouldn't prevent me from staying there again; it was a lovely place and an amazing location

Reviews.Title: “You could throw a rock and hit St. Marks!!”
Reviews.Author: DZKathrynE
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the "Painter's Suite" for our honeymoon in August 2010. You could throw a rock and hit San Marks! This hotel is great if you want to be close to all the action. It is literally less than a 2 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. From the painter's suite balcony you can watch the hammer clock guys move. The room was tiny, the bathroom was even smaller. I couldn't stand up in parts of the room. My husband and I couldn't be in the bathroom at the same time. There really wasn't anywhere to put luggage either. We had to put it on the floor to get stuff out and then close it back up and put it on the chair to get out of the room. The bathroom always smelled kind of funny too, not sure if it was the restaurant downstairs or what? The staff was very very nice. The entrance is controlled, you have to ring a bell and be let up by a staff member. This took some getting used to, but it was nice to know in a city as busy as Venice that the only people in your hotel were guests. I don't think I would stay here again. The balcony was amazing! But we only ate lunch on it once. It was nice to be so close to St. Marks (we were able to be the second people in line to get in one morning), but the streets were always busy. It got really old fighting through tour groups to get in and out of the hotel. Nice, good for a night or two if you want to be close to the action. Don't let me disuade you from going, but not romantic or spacious if that is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff & great value”
Reviews.Author: Simone393
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent four nights at Hotel ai do Mori and really enjoyed our stay. We already had long-standing booking at a 4 star hotel for 3 nights, but decided we wanted more time in Venice and since I had stayed at the Hotel ai do Mori on a previous visit to Venice some years ago we decided to spend the extra nights here before moving on to the other hotel. Considering the location (only steps from the Basilica San Marco), 100 euros for a bright, clean room with a private bathroom was very reasonable. Antonella and all the other staff were great - they were friendly and did their best to make our stay pleasurable, giving directions, information and advice and making restaurant reservations for us (a great help given our limited Italian). I was surprised to read a few negative reviews here - I suppose it is necessary to come with the right expectations and if you do so you will not be disappointed. As others have mentioned, the stairs are steep and narrow and you need to carry your luggage up yourself as there is no porter, but this was a minor inconvenience and I'm sure that if you truly can't manage because you are elderly or in poor health the staff would be happy to help you. Also, there can sometimes be a bit of noise (e.g. the bell from the Basilica ringing) but that is the price you pay for being at the centre of the action - personally we loved the lively vibe in that part of Venice, and we loved the convenience of the location. Our room (no. 8) was small but very clean, bright and pleasant, and the bed was comfortable. Air conditioning and free wi-fi were provided and worked well. In general, we were very happy with the value for money and the friendly staff. If you are looking for a simple, nice option right in the heart of Venice and do not require the extra services and space of a fancier hotel (at twice the price), the Hotel ai do Mori is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and awesome little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karisanic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few steps away from St Marc's square and just about a 5-10min walk away from Rialto. You can't ask for a better location. I had a double room - nr 8 - and it was a good size, it was clean & comfortable and the bathroom was neat as well. The staff was very friendly and also very helpful. The hotel has free wifi, however I had some issue connecting to it. But they directed me to a little internet cafe just around the corner, so that turned out to be no problem. One important tip though: You have to climb steep & narrow stairs to get to the reception area and then again to the rooms. So don't bring any big suitcases, you will have a tough time. :)

Reviews.Title: “a total disgrace”
Reviews.Author: zarax
Reviews.Content: myself moy mother and aunt went to venice a week n a half ago it was the most beautiful place i've ever seen in my life BUT the Ai Do Mori well the place was a hole! the staff and owner were very rude we were shouted and told to leave our room at such and such a time the woman (the owner) accused my mother n my aunt of smoking in the room which they were not there was personal belongings of ours stolen from the room the stair were a complete nightmare we were not offered any help with our luggage our room was a disgrace it was filthy everything was covered in dust the phone the headboard everything on one particular night we went t bed and there was no bed clothes on my bed we had to ask for a light to be put in the bathroom the pillows were and towels all had holes in the air -con wasn working it was just a shambles you like to be able to relax in your room at the end of the day and you just couldn;t to anybody planning a trip to venice i would not recommend stayin here you will regret it the place is a JOKE! IT'S A HOSTEL NOT HOTEL my mother normally stays in the all angelo hotel in san marco it would be definately a better choice from what i saw it is a really nice hotel and the staff seem really nice too. I WOULD NEVER STAY IN THE AI DO MORI AGAIN NOT EVEN IF YOU PAID ME !

Reviews.Title: “i did not like it at all”
Reviews.Author: lots65
Reviews.Content: what can i say about this hotel well not a lot we told we were on the first floor only to find we were on the 2nd floor we had 3 flight of stairs to carry our luggage up and was offered no help . the air conditioning was broke and it was very hot out . on the 2nd day the cleaner let her self in to our room with out knocking we were still in bed . day 3 my sister had to shower in cold water and the towel she took of the rail had a big hole. in it .the whole thing was the pits i would never stay in it again i stayed in a hostel last year we had a lovely room internet a breakfast a big bathroom the staff was lovely there . i found the staff in this hotel rude and not helpful at all

Reviews.Title: “good for the money”
Reviews.Author: darandriley
Reviews.Content: Good for the money, it was amazing to be right on St. Mark's Square at night when the restaurants have live orchestral music, but be aware that outside of the square this area is not very populated with tourists after dark. The hotel was a great price compared to ones in the area but it does not have a lift and we were required to haul the luggage up FOUR flights of stairs. The two woman who worked it helped with the last two flights but just be aware! Room was a triple and was really fairly tight but you dont spend alot of time there so not really an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Confortable”
Reviews.Author: Carol024
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this little and cosy hotel near Basilica San Marco, the location is a found! They dont serve breakfast but the beds are confortable and the room clean. We didnt get a great window view, nut was a very interesting experience to be at a restaured old building of Venice. Very nice staff, free internet only at the main hotel, ai do Mori, not in the rooms of the reformed appartment at spadaria street. Very close to vaporetto stops If you have lots of bags, ask for a low floor, cause they dont have elevators amd have lots and lots of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florentina13
Reviews.Content: I hate to write a negative review but it was deceiving when so many reviewers recommended this hotel. We stayed here for four nights and it was the longest four nights ever. The hotel was more like a hostel. We had to lug our luggage up four flights of stairs without any help from the gentleman who checked us in. Our room smelled like mold and we felt sick every time we came into the room. Only one window worked and you could only crack the other window open for fear that a pigeon would fly into the room. We ended up keeping the door open for ventilation. We noticed other guests were doing that as well. The bathroom was extremely small as was the shower which was full of mold. There was furniture in the room that was old and tattered. We had the luxury of a small table and chairs. The stuffing was popping out of the chairs and they were so dirty, I don't know who would want to sit on them. Venice is so beautiful and there is so much to do and see that no one should be hanging out in their hotel room but if you had the misfortune of getting sick and needed to stay in your room you would be in a bad position at the Ai Do Mori. The hotel is in a great location if you like San Marco and all of the crowds. It is extremely noisy at night and the restaurants in that area are mostly tourist traps. I would suggest staying in San Marco near the Accademia bridge or Dorsoduro where the location is more quiet and the restaurants are better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: katieepsomuk
Reviews.Content: Guess you pay for what you get - Reasonable price (95 euros p.night in a very EXPENSIVE city), enviable location, just seconds from St Marks square, rooms very very small and basic, hard beds and small bathroom but when you are in a city in Venice - how much time will you spend in your room? If you are looking for a budget stay in a great location, central to all the main sights and can forsake comfort and luxury, you wont get better than this, just dont expect anything more... Venice, as a city, is a novelty for me, like nothing I have seen before but full of tourists and very over-priced, if you can, do a full-day in Venice, ticking off the sights and then an excursion to Burano and Murano - very beauitful, quiet and amazing food! I would recommend this hotel for young travellers on a budget

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Keera
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel, when I was last time in Venice 3 years ago. If you really like Venice, the location of this hotel is everything you would ever dream about. On my request the owner proposed me a room in an Annex, absolutely independent from the hotel, just like in a rented flat. From this point it will take you just 2 minutes to rush to St. Mark's to Ñ�apture the dawn at half past six in the morning, when the square is full of space and washed up with the dawning light. The room is quite, as the windows face on a dead end street. The room includes tea and coffee facilities and a fridge, which might be helpful sometimes in the morning, since the hotel does not offer breakfast and the nearby bars are only open at 8 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: jnikjnik
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on the reviews and the offered price. The location was superb! (Yes you can see and hear the bells, but that's a part of the charm). The room was small, but clean and comfortable (so when you're out exploring all day and just need a nice place to sleep - what else do you need?). There is no lift and the stairs are on the steep side, so if have a problem with that - ask for the lower located rooms. The staff are friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know without hesitation and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION VERY ACCOMODATING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasbrit28
Reviews.Content: This very small hotel was recommended by a hotelier (near the Rialto Bridge) who was fully booked. A very lucky break as the Ai Do Mori has a far better location in one of the quiet little side streets behind St Mark's square. How much more romantic tthan to get on a waterbus from the station, go the full length of the Grand Canal, land next to the Doge's Palace and walk 100 yrds across the square to find your hotel! The staff were amazingly helpful in arranging for us to have the top floor attic room with a view of the famous clock tower and then moving us down to a proper double room when it became available. One qualification to be able to stay her is hauling luggage up 2 or 3 flights of narrow stairs. But otherwise everything is perfect due to this being in a genuine old building with no Americanized improvements - right next to every sight one needs to see - all within walking distance. Staff were very helpful advising on excursions to the islands and were on duty 24 hours. The only mishap that might be blamed on them was they didn't check our flight to ensure we went to the right airport.. So after a beautiful water journey to the wrong one we had to take a pricey taxi to the one Easyjet uses - and still caught our flight. Apparently this happens often - which is nice for the taxi guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great value adjacenbt to San Marco Sq.”
Reviews.Author: PaulandDebbie
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent with great recommendations re restaurants and activities Really 10 metres from San Marco Sq.!! The room was spotless & very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian0
Reviews.Content: Small hotel just off St Mark's square. It's clean and in good condition. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, helpful staff and a bag of wellies!”
Reviews.Author: niallmc89
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay with a young family (6 & 8) and other family members in this hotel. Location was amazing, but had a drawback of the bells being bloody loud at 7am and a lot of street noise at night. No breakfast facilities was compensated for by a cracking cafe across the road with delicious takeaway coffees, croissant marmelata and pasteries. Tea and coffee facilities in this room but not others. Room size for a family room was acceptable but had all the hotel guests walking past our room door. Room was clean and serviced during short stay. Staff, one in particular, were very helpful with advice and computer usage. As flood water was very high, a bag of wellies and umbrellas available to all (not kids sizes) was a great benefit. Enjoyed our stay, was good value for Venice at 100E (low season rate).

Reviews.Title: “First time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: drnani
Reviews.Content: All the hotels in Venice are EXPENSIVE. That being said, hotel ai do mori is relatively reasonably priced. The hotel has a main building and an annex. We stayed in the annex and were very happy with it. The furnishing/decor are elaborate in venetian style but at the same time sort of shabby chic, sort of like you were staying over at an aunt's guestroom. The bathroom was spotless. Breakfast consist of a prewrapped croissant and your choice of tea/coffee/ instant cappuccino mix to be made with your own little water thermos. There is fridge with wine glasses. Tatiana who greeted us on our arrival was personable, helpful and gave us wonderful recommendations for restaurants. It is centrally located( very busy/touristy area but great for being in the center of it all) and there's a pizza shop right downstairs. Great place for our first visit to venice. Only complaint: We had a double bed, it was 2 beds pushed together, which made sleeping in the middle with difficult. Either my husband or I would end up in the crack. However the mattresses themselves were comfortable, as long as you avoided where they were merged

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Donna9197
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is ideally located just off St. Mark's Square. The staff was very good about letting me know ahead of time that there was no lift, so we were prepared for that. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small, but we thought the overall experience was fine for the price. The desk attendant loaned us a tea kettle to take to our room so we could make our own tea/coffee. We were allowed to use the hotel's computer (in the reception area) to check e-mail, etc. We travel lightly, so the lack of an elevator did not pose a problem. The room with in suite bathroom was very small, but was clean. There was some street noise late at night, but we were so tired we didn't care. Also, the bells of St. Mark's Basilica ring very early and the streets of Venice get cranked up pretty early, too. This is a no-frills place to sleep. If I went back to Venice on a budget, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, wonderful and a pleasure!!! Views out of this world!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandy_jones15
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank you sincerely for our stay at your Hotel. You made us feel so welcome and we were appreciative of the champagne we received upon arrival when we said we had just got married. We absolutely loved both rooms, but the painters room was amazing along with the magnificant views of the Camponile and the Basilica! We had an amazing honeymoon and loved every minute of it along with the warming welcome received by yourselves!!!!!!!!!! Thank you ALL so much and we do hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: WithamWanderers
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel right near San Marco Square (great for transport links to the airport so no lugging cases over endless bridges, which we did on the way in from the train station). The rooms aren't huge by any means and those four flights of stairs are pretty darn steep, especially with cases. However, the staff are always on hand and very friendly and its good value for Venice. Having to go breakfast out in the morning is both a blessing (croissants and fresh orange juice in a sunny Venetian square in the morning) and a frustration (breakfasts aren't that easy to find, aren't cheap and it isn't always sunny in Venice!). Would recommend the hotel to anyone on a moderate budget, who doesn't plan to spend too much time in their room (why would you with Venice on your doorstep?) and doesn't mind steep stairs! Oh and the bells of the Camponile and Bascilica may well wake you up in the mornings!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, but service not so good”
Reviews.Author: AnaAmaral
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed Hotel Ai do Mori. It's a very simple hotel, but the room and the bathroom was very clean and nice. The only negative point about this hotel in my opinion is the staff. They didn't make me feel welcome and I think they could be a little more delicate.

Reviews.Title: “best value & service for san marco area accommodation”
Reviews.Author: dmk001
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most amazing location! It's right next to Piazza San Marco and the room I stayed in had a terrace which overlooked the domes of the cathedral, bell and the clock towers (loud at night but who cares - it's the famous Campanile!). Everything was exceptionally clean and in good condition and the staff were helpful with suggestions for local restaurants, travel agents, laundry etc All of which added to the ease & pleasure of the stay in Venice. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “for the price; this hotel hits all the right points!”
Reviews.Author: travel_hound
Reviews.Content: For just one night in Venice, this room exceeded my expectations. The costs was only $65 euros. The room was very small, we could barely fit our luggage, but for the price I really couldn't expect more. The room was clean, the sheets on the bed crisp and the towles fluffy. The location is the best part; literally 20 steps from San Marco's Square. The downside is the three flights of stairs with no elevator, but again for the cost of the room you can't expect luxury. For budget travelling, this place is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid value for great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in 2 rooms for 2 nights. This is a great value for Venice. The rooms are small, clean and pleasant. We had to go up three flights of stairs to get to our rooms with no help with luggage. It was not a problem for us but could be for others. We would stay here again. As far as Venice, we could not believe how crowded it was during the day when the cruise ships dump thousands of tourists off for the day. It sure was nice in the evenings when they all got back on the ship and left! Anyway, Venice is beautiful and unique and this hotel is a clean, comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable room. Shame about noise and lack of breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: jellis123
Reviews.Content: Positives: - A member of staff was on the desk all night. - Some of the members of staff were very helpful, offering advice on a restaurant that we ended up really liking. - Amazing location: two minutes from San Marco Square. - Pretty effective air conditioning. - Shutters on the windows. - Clean, well presented and comfortable room. - TV in room. - Sink in room (would have preferred en suite, but the sink was a bonus) - Amazing view of both the bell tower and the Basilica. Negatives: - Our room was at the top of three flights of stairs with no lift which was tiring in the heat and even worse when carrying suitcases up/down. - No en suite. - No breakfast. - The room was quite noisy at night and bright in the mornings. - The room was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “We would be happy to return any time”
Reviews.Author: steve-norf
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this great hotel. It is very central (it really is just a dozen meters from St Marks square) and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Although it does not have a resturant you really wouldn't want one when just outside the door are loads of bars and resturants and eating breakfast in the street is much more fun. The bedroom was a pretty normal size for a european city centre hotel (ie not very big) but it was airconditioned with a very comfortable and large double bed ideal for six footers like us. The room was clean and recently decorated and the shower was in good order. We booked this on the internet and their communications were excellent and helpful. For the price (very reasonable) I think this was excellent value for money in a city where everything is uber expensive. I would have no hesitation reccomending it and would certainly book it again next time we come to Venice (sadly may be a while as there's lots more of the world to visit yet). Like so many places in Venice this is not a hotel that is suitable for anyone who cannot climb stairs easily.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, Quality Room and the Best Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jfoote
Reviews.Content: There is no better location in Venice, if you wish to be a few yards from St. Markâ€™s Square. In the twenty years since I first stayed at the hotel, the great location hasnâ€™t changed nor has the responsiveness of the owner. The base price of 100 euro (cash) may be the lowest in this category. The rooms now have private baths/air conditioning, however, the floor space is tight. We stayed in the annex, about four rooms, which is around the corner of the main entrance. The room was nicely appointed with a king bed and a modern bathroom. There are good water taxi connections from the airport to St. Marks and also from St. Marks to the cruise terminal. For those that are fugal but desire a quality room and the best location in Venice, then the Ai Do Mori should be high on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: EmilyAus
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic -literally just around the corner from St Mark's Square. We were offered another room for our first night as there was going to be some streetwork during the night which would be noisy - this was really considerate and was at the expense of the hotel (two rooms occupied by us) for our comfort. The staff were helpful with information and booking tickets for walking tours, concerts, and boat tours ( as a side note-- we didn't, however, know about a strike which affected our trip to the airport on our departure, so make sure you ask or find out about this!). The airconditioning was great, rooms small but adequate, and bathroom good. Also had wifi (ask reception for password). Would definately stay here again, as it is in a fantastic location, a comfortable stay and overall good value for money (especially in Venice!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Hopitable, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TryingoutTraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early July, 2010. As other reviewers have mentioned, the accomodations are basic. However, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are very helpful and kind. We didn't mind the stairs as we're all in great shape now! :) One of our rooms had wonderfully well working AC and the other had decent AC (Perhaps the difference in floors made a difference in effectiveness?) , so we were comfortable despite the 30+ temperatures. The location can't be beat. The rooms are very quiet despite the crowds below. If you use a web based map program, you'll find the hotel quite easily. If you're looking for a good value in a good location and don't need a lot of "extras," we think you'll enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: martakeppler
Reviews.Content: We have been in the hotel Ai Mori for five days. Our room was large and spacious, nice bathroom with great shower. Chiara was very helpful and friendly and showed us good places to go. The hotel has no breakfast, but we had a kettle with tea, coffee and cappuccino and a small refrigerator. We stayed in the annex, which is in the next street. Antonella and Chiara gave us the keys so we are free to come and go. The hotel is in the best location in Venice, San Marco Square, and from there we went everywhere we wanted to go. We highly appreciate the hotel and we take great memories of Venice, one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel -close to the action in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Samson13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Venice for 3 nights as part of a European honeymoon. The price was very reasonable for what I was looking at for Venice, and not having been there before I wanted to book near Piazza San Marco. The cost was about 110 euros per night- does not include breakfast. Be sure to write down the street name for the hotel as while they are 10 meters from the Piazza it is sooo big, and the streets are so small this will save you some headache. However we found it relatively quickly. You have to buzz yourself in , and then walk up stairs. The ceiling is very low so of course my husband smacked his head on several occasions. After having taken the train from Switzerland to Venice, then a water taxi to San Marco (with large backpacks) we were exhausted and it was in the mid-30's temperature wise so we were hot! The hotel is quite warm as there is no air conditioning, and no real lobby, just a room on the second floor of the building. Luckily our room was only on the 3rd floor because there is no elevator - not the end of the world but after walking all day in extreme heat it was a little tiring. Rooms are clean, quiet, and very basic. I would have loved a microwave as Venice is very expensive so its nice to buy at the grocery store and stock up your fridge. There are in-room safes but we took everything and used a money belt instead. Decent service, staff were friendly, but I would spend a wee bit more on a return visit, and actually stay a bit further away from Piazza San Marco because it was just so crowded all of the time, but as soon as you walk away from the square the crowd thins and its much more enjoyable. There is truly more to Venice than Piazza San Marco :) One little negative was the nightman- while very friendly, he was in the bar next to the hotel every night instead of in the hotel ready to buzz you in. So we had to track him down first before we could be let back into the building. I understand the need to turn your keys in when you leave the room, but its nice to be able to get back into the building when you need to. My parents are headed to Venice in the fall and just to ensure they have a great visit, I will be researching other hotel options. There are 2 Best Westerns (at least in Venice) that I might try since you can expect a minimum level of service from chain hotels. When in Venice make sure to walk every where, and take the water ferry/taxi , there is sooo much to see and its also worth a trip to the Lido if its hot. If you buy a ferry pass this will also take you across to Lido, and when you get there just follow the crowd to the beach :)

Reviews.Title: “Like a dollhouse - a perfect gem!”
Reviews.Author: DanishTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We where staying at Hotel Ai do Mori for 5 nights. Perfectly placed right in the middle of everything. We booked "The Painters Room" because of the private roof terrace and it was PERFECT. What a view!!! The room is very small - almost like a dollhouse. Everything in the room is tiny - the room, the refrigerator, the kettle to cook water for coffee - except the coffee-cups and the roof terrace ;-) But nothing can beat the location, the extremely friendly staff and the big roof terrace overlooking San Marcus Square. And you will find everything you need to make coffee, the or cappucino the the room - free of charge! DONT BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEW ABOUT UNFRIENDLY STAFF - ITÂ´S NOT TRUE. Everybody was smiling, friendly and very helpfull. So my conclusion is, that it must have been the attitude of the former guest that was bad ;-) A bit noisy with the bell-towers - but then again - try to find a place in Venice whitout bell-towers ;-) I can highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “lOVELY,PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: suemac01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ai Do Mori for 3 nights. It was very easy to find. We were warned ahead of time about the stairs and no lifts. Read some other reviews that complained about this. The stairs are steep and narrow, but it was no problem for us. Antonella was great, as were all of the rest of the staff. We stayed in the Painter's room. The room is very small, but was spotless. The private terrace that comes with the room is to die for. The views were fantastic, and the bells were awesome. It is also a very safe hotel. You have to be buzzed in from the street, and again up the stairs to gain entrance to the hotel. You leave your room key with them when you leave, but someone is one duty 24/7 to let you in. No restaurant, but many cafes in the area. One warning-Venice is VERY crowded. It is eay and worth it to get off of the beaten path and just wander. Would definately stay in this hotel again. If you can't get the Painter's room, I would request a room at the back of the hotel. The streets are narrow and very noisy. Sue and Greg,USA

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great value”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSupersonic
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel Ai do Mori -- about one block away from the Piazza San Marco -- is really spectacular. Makes walking to the main locations in Venice much easier than from many other hotels, and saves a lot of time. It's also amazing that a hotel this well situated comes at such a reasonable price -- everything else I saw remotely in this price range is over on the other side of Venice (or in Mestre, a train ride away). On this basis alone -- fantastic location and excellent value -- it warrants an extremely good review, and I'd likely stay there again if I were to return to Venice. The front desk staff is very friendly, helpful, and accommodating, and they all speak fluent English. They helped us with maps, restaurant recommendations, directions, airport transportation options, etc. We didn't have any issues with noise in the hotel. To get up to the rooms in the hotel, it's a trek of about three flights of stairs, with no elevator. It's mostly fine, but something to take into consideration. If you have a disability or a heart condition, this hotel is not for you! Although my pregnant wife managed, it was a little difficult. For me, it was a chore carrying our luggage up all those flights when we arrived -- I had sweated through my clothes by the end -- but after that, it was totally fine. The rooms themselves are clean and perfectly adequate, but not winning any major design awards, with furniture on the older side. The room was a little small, but I suspect that's par for the course in Venice. The bathroom in our room was tiny, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misslinius
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife with 2 kids stayed in this hotel for 1night. Our experience was quite satisfactory. ==== Check-in === Our check-in was quite quick and efficient. We were offered a room in the annex building, not the same as the reception. ===Room=== The room we stayed in was quite small and odd shaped but well equipped with LCD TV, Water boiler, Tea-Coffee facilities. The room was quite clean. ===Location=== The room is location stone's throw away from St. Mark's square. Very good location. ===Miscellaneous=== The lady at reception was quite helpful in recommending trails and nearby attractions to us. The map provided may be accurate but we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “RIP-OFF”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandNeville
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is handy to St Mark's Square. We were in the annex, around the corner from the hotel reception. Room was clean, but bathroom tiny. Bed was firm - excellent. Street noise all night. Beware - there is no breakfast facility at the hotel. You have to find a suitable cafe for yourself. There is also no laundry facility at the hotel and the local one is ultra-expensive as it is not self-service. They even lost a sock for us and were closed for the weekend when we became aware - hence we have a spare sock now. However, the rip-off came when we checked out. We were charged Euros10 per night extra for using a debit card, when the hotel incurs no charges whatsoever for the debit card and gets its money almost immediately, unlike a credit card transaction. We are used to treating debit cards the same as cash. We would not recommend this hotel on the basis of being ripped off and the lack of a breakfast facility.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: APM_01
Reviews.Content: One minute walk to St. Mark's Square. We had a clean and comfortable if small room on the fourth floor, with no elevator. Don't bring a lot of luggage! The manager/owners were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: katelilybee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, right next to St Mark's Square. Staff were really friendly and incredibly helpful - allowing us to stay in our room until lunchtime on the day we left. The room was very clean with fresh, white towels. It was a bit noisy at night with the chiming of the bells and people in the street below - but that's the downside of being at the centre of everything and it didn't stop us sleeping. Nice little bar opposite for coffee and brioche for breakfast. Would certainly recommend this hotel, and would stay again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicki990
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex round the corner which is also a great location right by St. Mark's Square. The room was clean, with an excellent shower. The staff were very helpful offering to look after our bags on our last day as we had an evening flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jesss987
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, friendly staff, and couldn't have asked for a better location. We stayed in the annex room, which was around the corner from the hotel. The room was a bit small (to be expected!), but it was like having our own apartment in Venice! Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_SP
Reviews.Content: This is a simple but very good hotel. It is really close to San Marco square and is pretty decent. The only downsides are that it does not have an elevator (which can be a problem if you carry heavy bags due to its steep and narrow stairs - but its no that bad) and the strret can get a bit noisy at night. But it is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: ladylazarus77
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is small, but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom (in our room) was clean. Venice is expensive and, for being right next to St. Mark's, this hotel is a deal. Plus, the staff was friendly, too.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden pearl! Just perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: anoucka
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice as a backpacker in December 2008, and I must say this hotel was the most incredible surprise. It is located really close to Piazza di S. Marco (very very central, you coudn't ask for more!). After the small entrance door and the steep stairs, you have really cozy rooms, warm and nice, with wooden walls, and a bathroom with everything you may want in December in Venice (towel heater was so welcome then :) The staff was also very friendly. This hotel is the perfect option for a low-budget trip to Venice, I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “OK!”
Reviews.Author: AlondraG
Reviews.Content: The best, feature of this hotel is the location, it is really around the corner of San Marco. The room was ok for the price we paid... donÂ´t expect much!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: NAHR1234
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and welcoming - couldn't be any more central. Plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Get it in Writing”
Reviews.Author: dame_pink
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I booked a triple bed room for 3 people 4 months in advance for a long weekend.When we arrived, we were brought to a room which was bearly big enough to swing a cat. A dodgy camper bed with springs sticking out of it constituted the "third single bed", perched at the end of the double .... which made the cat swinging even more impossible!!!. The air conditioning did not work either which was a nightmare in such a small confined space with 3 people and the Venetian heat. Looking back they should have set the 3rd "bed" up in the bathroom!!! When we complained and asked for a larger room we were told by the Antonella that (a) she can arrange for us to stay in a nearby hotel at 350e a night (b) leave her hotel or (c) stay and still pay her the money. We found Antonella's people skills and magerial skills highly unsatisfactory especially when she started to scream down the phone incessantly to my friend. I speak Italian and it was clear she was more than just firey. Upsetting weekend overall. To sum up, before booking make sure you know eaxctly what you are paying for with this hotel and get it clearly stated in writing from Antonella and her staff!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Once you've found it...”
Reviews.Author: Andersons103
Reviews.Content: Contacted the hotel directly by 'e' mail reserved two rooms. The hotel takes a little spotting first time, but is just so close to St Marks square. Rooms were ideal for us, no breakfast but plenty of places to eat nearby. Really handy to be able to drop back to the hotel while sightseeing round Venice, as the one frustration I have with the City is that there are few places to just sit and rest. In a City where there are few bargains to be had this is at least good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean, great value for venice...”
Reviews.Author: oondartoy
Reviews.Content: Our room may have been small and our shared bathroom one flight up, but having such a clean place for a good price right behind the piazza san marco is surely one of the few good value propositions in venice! it is such a treat to walk out of the hotel at night almost onto the piazza when it is at its best...

Reviews.Title: “So central and so reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Googs27
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable with newly renovated bathrooms. Our bathroom had a spacious double shower, which was such a plus. The check-in staff member was very friendly and helpful. Just be prepared to carry your own luggage up and down narrow stairs. Staying so close to San Marco (2 mins walk) can be a plus but the crowds do get heavy during the day, making it difficult to get around if you need to cross the square. This hotel can't be beaten for value for money near San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, friendly base to enjoy Venice to the full”
Reviews.Author: clayman12
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel excellent value. The staff were welcoming and very friendly. The rooms were clean and had everything that a short sightseeing holiday requires. We shall be returning and will recommend the hotel to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Great room with wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel ai do Mori. My family and I were placed in the main hotel and had a clean room with private bathroom. Pluses included the phone in the room, great location, and reasonable price for Venice. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mamaral
Reviews.Content: Hotel ai Mori was one of grateful surprise during our stay in Venice in July. The location is perfect - right near the Piazza San Marco and also from the vaporetto( water bus) station. Staff is nice and discreet and room was perfect for a good B & B: clean, nice and quiet - which helped us a lot to relax after visiting the city. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Beakle
Reviews.Content: Ai do Mori is an excellent place to stay if you are looking for somewhere clean, convenient, reasonably priced and in an excellent location. Despite some other reviews I have read we did not have issues with any of the staff and found them helpful and polite throughout our stay. We were placed in the annex of the hotel which is just around the corner from the ai do mori. The room was a reasonable size and very clean. It was also suprisingly quiet considering its busy location just a minute from San Marco square and on a busy shopping street. The hotel was a little hard to find on arriving but that can be said for most places in Venice! It is easy to reach by taking one of the water ferries number 1 or 2 to San Marco square, and it is within easy reach of many important locations and places to sightsee. I would recommend buying a travel pass for the boats (24, 48 hours etc) as we found some ferry travel essential, particularly for getting too and from the station and seeing areas such as Murano, Giudecca and San Giorgio. Also avoid a number of the restaurants located near the hotel!! Many of them charge extortionate service charges (12% on top of 3 euro per person service charge) and the food is of poor quality. The stand up corner cafe is an exception to this and the pastries are excellent for breakfast. Overall I can't fault the Ai Do Mori, it was exactly what we expected and needed for our stay. No frills but a perfect base for exploring bustling Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IheartSugar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Annex" which is a separate building from the Reception. The room was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated. The room had sound proof windows and we never heard the bells ringing even though we were only a few meters from St. Marks Square! I have absolutely no complaints at all. It was a great value and a gem in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: nodan7
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place really is just a one minute walk to San Marco Square...the place you want to be. It is sooo convenient to be able to pop back into your room after a morning / afternoon of site seeing and to pop right out again into the throngs of Venice. The room, though sparse, was very clean. We stayed in the annex and noise was not a problem. Upon arrival, Tatiana checked us in and was pleasant and helpful. However, the next time I needed advice, the woman at the desk was not nearly as pleasant. She came across as too busy to help out...but isn't that why she is there?...not just to run a business. Upon check out, Tatiana was back and I even mentioned it to her. I do not know the name of the lady who was less than pleasant. Overall, yes, I highly recommend this place for budget-conscious travelers. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel should be in the top 10”
Reviews.Author: birdie13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel ai do Mori two years ago and did not post a review, thinking the secret would be out about this great find. I was shocked to read the negative comments and felt it necessary to point out a few things. You will NOT find a better location at prices anywhere, period, and believe me, after a long day of walking and stair climbing, location is everything! Venice is quite pricey, and the hotel rates here are excellent. I stayed with my neice and felt very safe and found the rooms to be spotless. Yes, the stairs are steep, and there is no lift. If a porter and elevator are a must for you, expect to pay a lot more somewhere else. I recently looked into booking a room for September and the owner ( Antonella ) and Chiara were extremely helpful. Although my plans changed and I will not be able to travel at this time, every email I sent, and I sent several, were returned quickly and professionally. Above and beyond, as I had many questions and requests. I will not stay anywhere else when I do return to beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Beat The Location, But The Owner Is The Worst Person Ever !!”
Reviews.Author: Pisceanne
Reviews.Content: Location : Just as they claim, Bang on San Marco's Square...This is the best location specially if its your first visit to Venice. We loved being on the square early in the morning and late into the night when barely anyone was around. Rooms : Clean. We got the new room in the annex which was very comfortable. As it is just above the street, may be a bit noisy during the day....though we didnt have any problems. Value & Service : Not value for money, you are going to pay heavily for the location. But the worst part is the extremely rude owner. She doesnt help you with anything, will only say 1 thing to you during the entire stay - pay me my money ! If you can find a nearby hotel, stay there. Else pick this hotel, but dont expect any service from the owner. Even the cleaning staff was rude and was cursing, because we walked in and were wet (it was pouring outside when we checked in - not our fault !)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/good value”
Reviews.Author: RonWhite
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to San Marco Square. Lots of stairs and no elevator (welcome to Europe). Rooms were small but clean and comfortable. Staff was very helpful. Some reviews mentioned the bells, but we didn't notice them. Venice hotels are generally expensive, but this was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gil_Par_RJ
Reviews.Content: It's small, but very charming, confortable and updated hotel. Rooms are very clean. The facillities are new and the staff is polited and helpfull. There are no elevator, but in Venice, it's ok. Best price we found in Venice. Certainly, if we return, we will stay at Ai do Mori.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: vindox
Reviews.Content: Let me first mention the positives - The location. You just cannot beat it! It is right behind St.Mark's and so the vaporetto stop is also close-by. Now the negatives. The host was kinda rude..When I just inquired whether there was someone to help me carry my luggage to the 3rd floor, she started lecturing me on how the confirmation email did mention about the room being on the 3rd floor and so on.. ..Hello..I was just inquiring.. I did not demand anything.. Then the room itself. I do understand that it is a budget hotel and the room would be small, but it really felt claustrophobic with inadequate air flow! It was a hot day and the air-conditioner wasn't working either (as promised in her email). I was just given a fan! When we headed out, we kept the windows open for air-flow, but someone from their staff closed them (I have no idea why they even entered the room!)

Reviews.Title: “If they send you to ANEX HOTEL, accept!”
Reviews.Author: EricArthurBlair
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 nights in Sep 2008, 2 in the "main hotel" and 1 in the "anex". The anex is another building, with no identification, just about 15 meters from the "main hotel". The room we've stayed in the "main hotel" was really small and dirty, specially the terrible curtains. The bathroom was clean, but small. The bed was too hard. The room in the "anex hotel" was bigger, newer and cleaner and the bathroom as well, but the bed was softer then a good night of sleep needs. The real "bonus" in the "anex hotel", addition the cleaning, is that you don't have to face the real steep stairs of the "main hotel", as I've stayed on the 3rd floor in the "main hotel". The staff in the reception changes a lot, but they're all friendly and helpful. The location is awesome, really close to Piazza San Marco. There's a McDonald's close to the hotel too, and I think it should be a touristic point, as it is the dirtiest McDonald's I've ever seen. But all Venezia is not that cleand, right?

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: eos99
