Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2009. Excellent staff! The staff here are really helpful and went out of their way to help us find a room for another night in Venice since they were booked. Rooms are simple and clean. Our room size was quite small and did not have a private bathroom. However, the bathroom that we shared on the top floor was very clean with hot running water with good pressure. My boyfriend's parents had a room with a private bathroom and that room was an adequate size with a very clean bathroom, as well. This is a great value hotel with an excellent location that couldn't be closer to Piazza San Marco. No elevator in hotel and breakfast is not included. This is a no-frills hotel. But heck, for the killer bargain on the room, you could buy your own breakfast and still save lots of money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: naomivb
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly people at the desk. Great value for money. Only criticism is that there are quite a few steep stairs so it was difficult getting luggage up and down. Also because it is right near the square the bells from the bell tower can be quite loud. But really enjoyed Venice and this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JHUkozmoe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel ai do Mori for one night in Venice. Being on a budget, I thought about staying on Mestre to save $. I was delighted when I found this hotel as it was in an ideal location. The price was competitive if not even cheaper than hotels on the mainland. I was placed in the annex part of the hotel and the room was clean and comfortable. Best decision I make on my trip.

Reviews.Title: “the bells”
Reviews.Author: patbrownett
Reviews.Content: we booked this based on trip advisor reviews. Location excellent,However what other reviewers have not mentioned is the fact that for light sleeper the bells from st marks square every hour means very little sleep if, like us you are light sleepers(even withear plugs in)Also the tv does not have an english channel.they claim channel 9 as bbc but not during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Celia93
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel from 26th january til the 4th of february 2009, and we were really very satisfied with our stay. The hotel is next to St. Marc square, it takes you 15 seconds to arrive in the basilic. And, most of all, it was really extremely clean. Our room was big enough for us, and we had a bathroom, wich had been completely redone, so it was perfect. We also had a telephone, a hair dryer and a small tv, and this for only 50 euros the night. The room was also very warm, we had also a towel heater in the bathroom. There are double windows so rooms are quite and calm. You have also to know that you have to pay cash and they don't serve breakfast, but there are some good coffees next to the hotel, where you can have a capuccino for 1,50 euros and some pastries for about the same price. All people working there were very kind and helpful, they even let us check our mails from their internet point, they let us umbrellas and boots for the water. It isn't the first time I go to Venice, but for sure, next time we'll go again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Price in san marco square”
Reviews.Author: catrapumba
Reviews.Content: We stay at "ai do mori" for only 1 night (23-24 december): the room was small but clean, heated and simply furnished. For 50 euro per night (low season, 2 pax, no breakfast included) at 1 minute by foot from San marco square, this hotel is unbeatable for no frills tourists. simone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: DavidS13
Reviews.Content: Great location for this place, right of Piazza San Marco. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We stayed in the Painter's Room, which has a private rooftop patio with cool vistas over the surrounding buildings, can't quite see into the piazza though. Room was a bit snug, not much space to move beyond the limits of the bed. Be prepared for stairs, especially for that room. It's about 4 flights from the street.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, you won't need much more!”
Reviews.Author: chetz7
Reviews.Content: For 100 Euro in Italy's most expensive city, you probably won't get a better located/central hotel than this one. It is literally 25 steps from San Marco Square, the main thoroughfare. The hotel itself is more than adequate, despite the steep steps to get to your room. Aside from this, the room is air-conditioned, which is a necessity in and around summer, and its extremely convenient to a lot of Venice's main attractions. Check-in was hassle free and the rooms were spotless. What's more, having a hotel in the middle of the action allows some respite from the relentless Venetian heat if you want to have a lay down for 30min and a shower in the middle of the day. No significant noise either, it was definately a good stay and I have already recommended this to someone else!

Reviews.Title: “"Wow" note the inverted commas.”
Reviews.Author: Jalexica
Reviews.Content: I did not even manage to complete my booking...... Unfortunately this hotel happened to be my first experience in trying to book a hotel in Venice. I was trying to book through email and that started pleasantly enough ~~> soon turned a bit nasty however. I accidentally booked the wrong dates and emailed the hotel stating my mistake and asked if it could be rectified. I was advised that yes there was availability but the price had gone up. Also fine considering that I had booked the wrong month. I said I needed a little bit of time to consider this and at the same time also asked if there was anything else that they might be able to do about the price. (not expecting a problem/rudeness as I had read some wonderful reviews of the people that worked there.) Maybe it is a communication/language barrier but the overall tone of the message i received in return seemed to be very rude. In addition the price had gone up even further. and I was told (from what I understood of the message) that my original booking had been cancelled. From what I could tell by my limited experience, the price offered per night does not include politeness..or a sense of courtesy and in my case that was just not acceptable. In closing all I can say is exactly what was said to me.."Thank you anyway and best regards" Right back atcha

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in unique â€˜Painterâ€™s Roomâ€™; convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: jessfm107
Reviews.Content: I requested the Painterâ€™s Room (#11) many months in advance and my request was fulfilled with no problems. I had read all about the room, so the tight spaces were only a small but expected issue; a bed-crossing to get to our private bathroom was fun, and husband and I had just enough space to unpack our belongings (one carry-on luggage and one backpack each), utilizing corners and the cute wardrobe in the room. After 77 steps (from the street and through the reception on the 1st floor), we arrive at the main level of the room, which has its own steps from roomâ€™s door. Actually, at first I was expecting more flights of steps, but as days wore on, the climb became a ghastly-but-laughable challenge. Most importantly, our room had its own balcony with great views of San Marcoâ€™s onion domes, the Campanile, the â€œbronze knockersâ€� bell of San Marcoâ€™s clocktower, and all of the rooftops around us. We took as many opportunities to relax there as possible, and it was quite private (never had any distant onlookers from other balconies). Also used the sink and laundry line out there to wash our clothes. Unfortunately, our view of the domes were obscured by scaffolding over the left spires of San Marco, but no worries- its all for the greater good, and we were still excited and felt lucky to stay in such a unique room. The staff was very friendly, and I thank Antonella for assisting my husband in planning a special birthday for me. She recommended a side canal starting point for the intended gondola ride as well as a Vivaldi concerto around the corner, which we really enjoyed. Other amenities: newer facilities in bathroom, satellite tv (with international CNN, helpful to keep up with US/election news).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: jetlkh
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with separate bathroom at 90E per night The hotel is conveniently located just outside of St Mark's Square (It claimed 10 steps on its website, but our short legs took us more.. slightly more..) The room is small and well decorated. Rest was good though the bathroom is one level up from our room. (Pretty inconvenient but we haven't seen any other persons using it though the rooms were fully booked.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but know what you're getting into”
Reviews.Author: Casanova28
Reviews.Content: Considering how expensive Venice is, you're definitely getting a good value at the Hotel Ai Do Mori. The city of Venice has figured out that if tourists will pay 100 Euros to sit in a gondola for half an hour, then they'll pay anything for everything. Hotel Ai Do Mori provides a clean room for around 130 Euro a night (in high season). For Venice, that's an incredibly good deal. The hotel is literally fifty yards away from St. Mark's, just as advertised, and the staff was very friendly. Those are the pluses. As for minuses...well, basically you just have to know that with that little price comes little comfort. The bed is fine. The shower is fine. Everything is just fine. Full disclosure - our room was in the Annex on the second floor. So we didn't stay in the main building (which as far as I could tell had similar amenities). Our biggest beef with the Annex was that even though the windows are double paned with shutters, you still hear the throngs of tourists that join together at 8 AM and roam the streets of once-quaint Venice until past midnight. Furthermore, if you're in the Annex, you're basically on your own. This was bizarre at first, but by the end, we didn't mind. It was kind of fun actually. But there's no lobby in which to hang out, no communal hotel feeling. Just you and your three keys which get you through the several layers of locked entry ways en route to your room. And again, we didn't mind. But if you're the kind of traveler who likes to mingle with the other guests, this ain't the place. All and all, Hotel Ai Do Mori is perfectly decent. Would I go back? Probably not. But that's more because I don't want to stay near the thousands of tourists that descended on St. Mark's like seagulls diving into the ocean. Actually, this gives seagulls a bad name. The parade of tourists was more like a flock of vultures pecking away at the last scraps of peaceful Venice. I guess I was one of the tourists too so I shouldn't talk. I'm part of the problem. But I do know a decent hotel from a really good one, and Ai Do Mori is simply a decent one. And that's fine, as long as you're cool with that going in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: lenmat
Reviews.Content: We contacted Antonella directly after reading other positive reviews of Hotel Ai do Mori on-line, and were booked in the Annex. Not only was the price very reasonable compared to many other options in Venice, but - as others have stated - our room in the Annex really was almost like having our own (little) apartment. The room was clean, quiet and secure, and was in a great location just off San Marco square. We would not hesitate to recommend Antonella's wonderful hotel to our friends and family should they plan to visit Venice! Len Mattson - Chicago, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Definite pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Krivokrasov
Reviews.Content: There were some good points and bad points about this hotel. The location is definitely a plus, being a 30 second walk from Piazza San Marco. We also got a very good rate on the room by paying cash (70 Euros per night). The room was clean and the A/C worked well. However, there were some downsides. The room was extremely small and cramped. There was not enough space to lay 2 medium size suitcases anywhere in the room. We also didn't have a bathroom in our room, and though I've stayed in many hotels without an en-suite bathroom, I've not stayed at many that had it on a completely different floor. The stairs in general were not a lot of fun (especially with baggage). 3 flights up and down each time you went in your room. As for the staff, the people who checked us in didn't seem very friendly, but the staff the following day was nicer. All in all, I would probably look for a different place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GusM
Reviews.Content: A good simple low cost hotel in the heart of Venezia. The staff was very helpful if not real knowledgeable of the area or current events such as the one-day vaperetto and train strike. I donâ€™t know if this was the language barrier or what. But we managed to get through. The hotel has very steep stairs with no lift, so this may be an issue for some people. Good clean hotel at a great price for being steps away from the square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: APringle
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful when they realized my husband had pulled a muscle in his leg. It is a perfect location for all activities in Venice and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: dreadnaught_lover
Reviews.Content: If you're not afraid to climb stairs, and want a small, cozy hotel right in the heart of San Marco, this is a great place. The young man who checked us in was so helpful and friendly; he even called a friend who worked at a local restaurant, and his friend came and walked with us to the restaurant, which was a great experience and off the beaten path, away from the crowds. We took a room on the top floor (that's 5 floors up from the street), but the views of the rooftop of San Marco's and the Campanile were worth the climb. A small, comfortable, clean room with a lot of old world charm. The price can't be beat for the location. A bonus is that it's easy to find - we appreciated that after long hours of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: suedoah
Reviews.Content: The room was very small but clean and the hotel for being close to the square was quiet. I would say the only downfall to this hotel is the stairs. The staircase is very narrow and you have to go up two flights of stairs just to reach the office. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Close”
Reviews.Author: sw-dal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 6 of the hotel. Tremendous location. Maybe one of the few hotels in Venice you can locate without a map. The room was small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Rmlind
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Easter weekend. We got the same message as a previous reviewer reported, that they require a minimum of three days stay on weekends and at Easter, and I see why. The city was jammed with tourists, Italian and otherwise, even more so than a normal weekend, according to some residents we talked with. We concur with all the reviews we've read: perfect location (and even quiet with the good modern double-pane windows closed), friendly and informative staff, and good exercise climbing stairs. We'd stay there again, even with their cash-only policy.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne15
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Venice at the Al Do Mori in March. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not surprised with how delightful the hotel was. It's a gem. We stayed in their recently renovated annex which was around the corner from the original hotel. This was a bonus. It felt like our own apartment in the heart of the city. The room was clean and our view was not spectatular nor was the room large but we did hear the church bells of San Marco. The shower is small and the room is basic but it is clean, cheap and quiet. The location of the hotel can not be beat. It's perfectly central to see and do everything in Venice. And seeing San Marco at 7am, before the mass of tourists get there, was just so special. I didn't mind not having a breakfast-- for 3euro, i had a cappucino and crossiant and the nearby cafe. By the third morning, I had become a regular and my coffee was ready when she saw me coming. We have already recommended this hotel to others and wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Venice in comfort”
Reviews.Author: garlandWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We 'discovered' Hotel Ai do Moro on the recommendation of friends, and first stayed there in 2005. It is literally just a short passage way from Piazza San Marco, and a five minute walk from the Allilaguna jetty for the boats that cross the Lagoon to and from Marco Polo airport - quite the most romantic way to get to the city. So, very convenient for getting to the Basilica and the Palazzo Ducale first thing ahead of the bulk of the other tourists, and situated as it is right in the heart of Venice, it is an ideal spot for reaching all the other tourist attractions as well, although the biggest attraction has to be the streets of Venice herself. Warning -take your most comfortable walking shoes, preferably two pairs. There is no alternative to Shank's Pony unless you want to spend a fortune on vaporetto Tourist tickets (currently 6.50(!) euros a journey, although there are 12, 24 36 etc hour versions which work out slightly cheaper!) or the even more expensive water taxis. This rapacious grabbing of tourist cash is a new development. Locals pay a fraction of these prices, which I suppose is fair enough in a way, but can leave a bad taste in the mouth , especially when a conductor gets stroppy because you haven't been able to buy tickets before boarding because the ticket booth is closed, and he is convinced you are trying to get a free ride. I know that must happen, but it is not pleasant to experience such mistrust when you are not actually trying it on. The hotel itself is two floors above ground level which can be a pain when you're lugging cases up two flights of narrow stairs. However, it means that noise from the street isn't quite so intrusive, and, in the event of the acqua alta, you are well removed from the rising waters. The rooms are all comfortable (some smaller than others) with excellent en suite facilities, reasonable clothes storage space, efficient heating in the cooler months and air-conditioning in the summer. You can see (and hear!) the bells of the Clock Tower in the Piazza from most windows. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful, being anxious to make you feel at home, and the rates are reasonable all year round, considering the location. We paid 135 euros a night for a twin room during our most recent stay over Easter weekend. In fact, on another trip, we paid almost as much staying in Mestre and travelling into Venice every day. I made our bookings by email and received prompt and clear replies in English - made me quite ashamed of my lack of Italian! No food is provided (apart from the two very much appreciated tiny easter eggs on our pillows when we arrived!), but when there is an excellent cafe - one of the stand and eat/drink ones that abound in Venice - opposite the entrance that seems to be open all hours, why worry? Once you've had your wake-me-up coffee/tea/whatever and croissant (chocolate or apricot jam - yummy!), you are ready for the fray, or at least until the next coffee shop/gelaratia/pizzeria comes into view. And when the day get too exhausting, your room is always easily reached from most parts of the city for a welcome rest, before sallying forth to continue sampling the delights of Venice. A delightfully sensible place to stay in that most un-sensible of cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good price - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mac6641
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in January 2008 and would highly recommend this hotel for Venice visitors. The location, right behind St. Mark's Square, was great. We had two rooms, both, while small, were well appointed and very clean. The bathrooms had all amenities including shampoo, conditioner and a hair dryer. Be prepared for several flights of stairs, so it's not for the mobility impaired, but I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my booking-very rude!”
Reviews.Author: aBabyMoon
Reviews.Content: I have not actually stayed in this hotel, however I am desperately disappointed in it already. I made my reservation on Jan 2, 2008 for March 23-27 via a hospitable chain of emails. On Feb 13 I wrote to cancel one day of our stay because of transportation issues and this is how they responded "Dear Sir, Sorry, but on Easter week time we do not accept reservations for 3 days only. We could accept for 3 days starting from Monday the 24th for 3 nights, but not like that. We are obliged to cancel the entire reservation, thank you anyway and best regards." This policy was NEVER written anywhere! To cancel an entire reservation without my request was absurd! Where am I supposed to stay? I wrote back politely that I did not wish my reservation to be cancelled and would try to accomodate their "policy". Their response was this "Sorrym the room is already sold, thank you and best regards." I could not believe it! We still need a room and have a few leads but was really looking forward to this hotel and its location. We are trying to reach management and figure this out but I could never recommend this hotel because of its terrible business ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: luvskittles
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ai Do Mori is perfect for budget travelers who want to stay in the heart of Venice. Even though the hotel is located steps from St. Mark's square (great benefit), it is very quiet at night and the hotel staff is friendly, always offering helpful advice. The rooms are kept very clean and are very practical. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: GalwayMike
Reviews.Content: You'll be hard pressed to find a better value in all of Venice. Rooms are simple, ours was essentially a bed and a TV with the bathroom shared between 2 rooms, but everything is very clean, the AC works just fine, and the staff is beyond compare. We had wanted to see the Rugby World Cup final on the tele and the staff identified a place where we could watch it, made reservations for us, and got the owners to give us a free drink! And the location cannot be beat: 10 steps away from St. Mark's puts you in the heart of the city and can give you a head start on the crowds to see St. Mark's or the Palace Ducale.

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled my booking....”
Reviews.Author: Mignonandchic
Reviews.Content: I had confirmed my booking with this hotel. When my travelling partner couldn't make it, I emailed them to ask if they had single rooms instead and their response was to cancel my booking. When I received their email, I replied straightaway politely asking them not to cancel. I was unhappy of course. I then received a couple of very unapologetic and hostile emails (e.g. sentences written in bold) telling me it was my fault for not replying sooner to their email, that the hotel was now fully booked, and no apology or offer to assist in any way. It was terrible and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this gem!”
Reviews.Author: rori1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in the heart of Venice. It's family-run and it is very charming. I got a small but very cute and clean room. The staff is very friendly and helpful with recommendations/discounts for dining, concerts, shopping, etc. The price in December was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter638
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at an affordable hotel in the centre of Venice, you've found the place! Although we had an incredibly small room, it was clean and comfortable, as was the bathroom we shared. Plus, the view more than made up for the lack of space! The location is absolutely perfect as you are literally a few steps away from the main square in Venice. Be prepared to walk up several flights of stairs to your room - ours was five flights up, with no elevator. Overall, we thought it was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel in Venice near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: john2512
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Do Mori doesn't look like much from the street, and they don't offer breakfast. Those things said, everything else is positive. The room we had in their annex was called the "Lion" room, and it was very spacious and quiet. It had three windows overlooking the street, but there was little noise. The private bath had a lavatory, toilet with bidet seat and a large shower with lots of good pressure and abundant hot water. The floor was hardwood, and the ceiling was beamed. The room was located on the first floor above ground level, and had good security. There was daily maid service, and all towels and sheets were changed fresh each day. There was no coffee/tea making service in the room, but many small bars were nearby where a quick cup could be gotten. The location is excellent. It is located on Calle Larga San Marco, and you get there by passing through the arch under the clock tower with the blue tile and the "Moors" who hammer on the bell at the mark of each hour. Turn right at the first corner, and the hotel is located on the left side at the next corner. It is just next to a McDonald's restaurant, and is literally just steps from San Marco Square. The price is very reasonable for Venice and I would stay there again. Clean, comfortable, quiet and relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Silvergold
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive little hotel is a great find as it was clean, well managed, and just steps from Piazza San Marco, which was extremely convenient for meeting up with friends. The only negative, and I was aware of it, is that there is no elevator and I stayed on the top floor. There was no breakfast provided either, but it is next door to a McDonalds (which I didn't go to, but could have in a pinch) and so close to many cafes. I had been nervous that the hotel might be in a noisy area so close to San Marco but it wasn't. I slept very well and was extremely comfortable. I'd recommend this to anyone who can manage the flights of stairs. The staff were all very kind and helpful. As I was staying here for two nights alone, I felt very safe and welcome in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuffnut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block from St. MArk's square which is the busiest part of Venice. St. Mark's is packed with tourists so expect the location to be very busy and noisy. The Belltower is right next door so expect also to hear the bells ringing at night - one bell rings every hour and the other rings several times. After a while the ringings can be very annoying. Restaurants around St. Mark's abound but are mostly tourist traps, you'd be better off finding a good pizza place or eating at the McDonalds next door. Or you may walk a bit farther from the area and try to find a good deal. The stairs leading up to the reception desk and rooms are steep and very narrow (no lift) so try to pack light. Rooms are small but the bathrooms are clean and convenient. The rate we paid was probably fair for Venice standards and particularly in the area of St. Marks. However I probably wll not stay in this hotel again or in this area of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: Cbr_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights during September and although it is a little hard to find, found this to be the best value we got the whole time in Venice! Our room had a really clean, new bathroom, functioning airconditioning and a view. The staff were always pleasant and we couldn't have wished for more. If you are referring to any other travel guides that mention a breakfast terrace, we were told this had been converted into a private suite and is no longer available for other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: J_J_traveller
Reviews.Content: The location and the price are excellent! The room was very nice and charming and loved the kitchenette. Very clean. Only downfall was the street noise (it is in the heart of tourist central). Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A true little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Girl25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Ai Do Mori with my boyfriend for 3 nights & I was very impressed by the hotel's cleanliness & fantastic location. I had read previous reviews so I was well aware that the property has some steep stairs & no lift. We were on the top floor (room 8)so had to climb the stairs, we only had one suitcase though so it wasn't a problem. Our room was small, however I don't believe anyone visits Venice to stay in their room! I made the reservation based on the other reviews in this forum & because I was struggling to find somewhere in my price range close to the sights in Venice. I think for the price this place is a real find. The room was cleaned every day & the staff were very friendly & helpful. The real bonus though is the location - the hotel's proximity to San Marco means you'll never get lost - because San Marco is signposted from everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: pierogi
Reviews.Content: Our family of four staying the a suite apartment in late June 2006 and found the hotel and location to be wonderful for us. It's close to the vaporetto stop, with friendly and helpful staff. Our room had two separate bedrooms with a separate shared bath. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. The kids' room had two twin beds (not rollaways) with good air conditioning. Our room was larger with a comfortable bed but the same size air conditioner. Since we were there during a heat wave, our air conditioner was underpowered for the room and it stayed pretty hot at night. (Probably stayed close to 30 C in our room.) The bathroom was good sized and updated. If you can deal with climbing the steps (no elevator), it's a great location and a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a bit better”
Reviews.Author: jb+nmo
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. The biggest plus was its location. It was very central, within minutes of Piazza San Marco and the cathedral. restaurants were plentiful around the area and you literally could go to the Rialto bridge, Dorsuduro and other major landmarks within 10-15 minute walks. The rooms were clean but plain. Certainly for budget travellers this would be acceptable. As honeymooners, there were no "extra" amenities. The bathroom and shower stall, although private and en suite, was crowded and tiny. At no times could more than one individual enter it. Reading the reviews on Trip Advisor at the time of booking a few months earlier, there appeared to be a recurring theme of the friendliness of the hotel staff. I can't say that either of us were too impressed. They were extremely business-like and cold (unlike most of the other italian establishments we stayed at), with no emotions, ie: here's the key, pay us the money etc... Overall, it's clean, central, but nothing extraordinary to write home about. Average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice to all the guests!”
Reviews.Author: LittleOphelia
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice, in this wonderful Hotel, just in these days. We really have to thank Antonella , the manager, and all her staff. There was a bad strike of waterbuses and she gently organized for us the way to get into the city. They all are very professional and especially very very nice to all the the guests. We really recommend Hotel Ai Do Mori also for the lovely clean rooms, for its wonderful location but even more for its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TDog47
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in the middle of April this year. It has a great location and great staff. It's located in the middle of everything and you can easily access all the major places to see and restaurants by walking. Be advised that there is no elevator at this hotel and our room was on the fourth floor. We had a great view of the San Marco Bell Tower and also of the street below. The room was very clean and not too small like some other European hotels can be. For the price, you can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: NancyAnn31
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location and a super value for those wanting a no frills, great location place to stay. They were helpful with tour reccomendations, restaurant suggestions, sights, etc. Martina is a jewel!!! There is no elevator though and the stairs are steep, so don't bring a lot of luggage to haul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: wbstauffer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice in June 05. This hotel was perfect. The air conditioning was welcoming. The rooms were small, but very clean and overlooked a busy venice street right off of St. Mark's Square. The staff was friendly and helpful. I thought this hotel was a perfect location and a super value.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel ai do Mori
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Larga San Marco | San Marco 658, 30124 Venice, Italy
